message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a method for stemming in morphologically complex texts, which is a common problem in natural language processing. The paper discusses statistical techniques for stemming and focuses on finding affixes in different positions of a word, including infixes. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of stemming in information retrieval tasks, which suggests a possible sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper uses statistical techniques, which could also suggest sub-categories of cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the use of the proposed method in text mining tasks, which could suggest a sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
